security_audit.summary: This is documentation/guidance skill containing no malicious code. It provides example patterns for web-CLI integration with explicit security warnings. The static analyzer flagged example code patterns (exec, child_process) that are documented educational examples with acknowledged security considerations. The skill itself documents these risks and provides security best practices.

high_findings.title: Command Injection Risk in Example Code
high_findings.description: The bridge server example at SKILL.md:251-255 uses exec() with unsanitized user input. While documented as an anti-pattern with explicit warnings, implementers must add proper input validation and command whitelisting.

medium_findings.title: No Authentication in Example Server
medium_findings.description: The example bridge server lacks authentication. Anyone with network access can execute CLI commands. The skill documents this as a best practice to implement (line 470).

medium_findings.title: Unrestricted CORS Configuration
medium_findings.description: CORS origin is set to '*' which allows cross-origin requests from any domain. Documented as a security consideration.

content.user_title: Bridge web interfaces with CLI workflows
content.value_statement: Users need a way to integrate web applications with command-line tools for real-time communication. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for building bidirectional web-CLI bridges using REST APIs and WebSockets.
actual_capabilities: Build REST API endpoints for CLI command execution
Create web interface components to trigger CLI commands
Deploy bridge server with Express and Socket.io
limitations: Skill provides guidance only, not executable code
Requires manual implementation of security measures
No built-in authentication or command whitelisting

use_cases.title: Build System Integration

prompt_templates.title: Basic Bridge Setup

prompt_templates.title: Security Hardening

output_examples.input: Build a web interface that can execute CLI commands
Design API for bidirectional web-CLI communication
output: POST /api/cli/execute - Execute CLI command from web
POST /api/web/render - Render web UI from CLI

best_practices: Implement authentication and command whitelisting before deployment
Validate and sanitize all user inputs to prevent command injection
Use rate limiting and CORS restrictions to protect API endpoints
anti_patterns: Using exec() with unsanitized user input directly
Leaving CORS open to all origins in production

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex for generating bridge components and server implementations.

faq.question: What are the performance targets?
faq.answer: API response under 200ms, WebSocket latency under 50ms, command execution under 5 seconds, uptime above 99.9%.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing CLI tools?
faq.answer: Yes, the bridge can wrap any CLI tool by sending commands through the REST API or WebSocket connection.

faq.question: How do I secure the bridge server?
faq.answer: Implement authentication, validate all inputs, whitelist allowed commands, restrict CORS origins, and add rate limiting.

faq.question: What if commands hang or timeout?
faq.answer: Implement timeout mechanisms for long-running commands and use async execution with proper error handling.

faq.question: How is this different from SSH?
faq.answer: This provides web-based access without SSH infrastructure. It is designed for controlled, API-driven command execution with a graphical interface.
